sn10.4:4.1: At one time the Buddha was staying in the land of the Magadhans at the Maṇimālika tree shrine, the haunt of the native spirit Maṇibhadda.
sn10.4:4.2: Then the native spirit Maṇibhadda went up to the Buddha,
sn10.4:4.3: and recited this verse in the Buddha’s presence:
sn10.4:5.3: Each new day is better for the mindful,
sn10.4:6.3: Each new day is better for the mindful,
sn10.4:6.4: but they’re not freed from enmity.
sn10.4:7.1: But someone whose mind delights in harmlessness,
sn10.4:7.3: with love for all living creatures—
sn10.4:7.4: they have no enmity for anyone.”
